oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Unusual difference in the reactivity of seven-coordinated Mo(II) and W(II) carbonyl complexes, [Mi(2)(CO)(3)(NCCH3)(2)] with derivatised-dppm, Me3SiN=PPh2CH2PPh2
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: BALAKRISHNA, MS
PANDA, R
PRIYA, S
GEORGE, PP
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: transition-metal chemistry
phosphorus-based ligands
x-2 = o2c6h4
ruthenium(ii) chemistry
rhodium(i) complex
crystal
ph
bis(phosphino)amines
x2pn(r)px2
phosphine
mo(co)(3)i-2(ncch3)(2)
me3sin = pph2ch2pph2
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The reaction of [Mo(CO)(3)I-2(NCCH3)(2)] with a stoichiometric amount of Me3SiN=PPh2CH2PPh2 gives an octahedral complex, [Mo-3] (CO)(eta(2)-N=PPh2CH2PPh2)] by the metathetical elimination of Me(3)Sil. Interestingly, similar reaction of the analogous tungsten complex gives a seven-coordinated complex, [WI2(CO)(3)(eta(2)-Me3SiN=PPh2CH2PPh2)] which ultimately hydrolyses to give an amide complex, [W(CO)(3)I-2(eta(2)-HN=PPh2CH2PPh2)]. The complexes have been characterised by microanalysis, IR and NMR (H-1 and P-31) spectroscopic data.
